body.p: Some endurance athletes have tried blood doping (now illegal) to increase the amount of oxygen they can deliver to their tissues. This involved collecting red blood cells and re-injecting them several weeks later as a way of increasing their hematocrit (red blood cell concentration). What effect would blood doping have on vascular resistance?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Doping has an effect on the viscosity of blood.
Correct. Doping increases the viscosity of blood, which increases its resistance to flow.
Incorrect. Doping makes the blood more viscous, which increases resistance.

part.hint: Consider whether or not increasing hematocrit will have an effect on any properties of blood.
